articles.title: Brooks Koepka says time for physical recovery, changed opinion led to LIV Golf move
articles.description: Brooks Koepka said ahead of his first LIV Golf tournament that he didn't agree to join the series until after he played in the U.S. Open, and that a simple change of opinion, coupled with more time to physically recover, led to the move.
articles.content:
NORTH PLAINS, Ore. -- Four-time major champion Brooks Koepka said Tuesday that he didn't agree to join the LIV Golf Invitational Series until after playing in the U.S. Open two weeks ago.

articles.title: Los Angeles Angels RHP Archie Bradley out at least 4 weeks after fracturing elbow during brawl with Seattle Mariners
articles.description: Angels right-hander Archie Bradley will be sidelined for at least a month after suffering a fractured right elbow while going over the dugout railing to join Sunday's on-field brawl with the Mariners.

articles.title: Serena Williams loses first-round match at Wimbledon to Harmony Tan
articles.description: Serena Williams, in her first singles match since being injured in the first round of last year's Wimbledon, rallied multiple times in her first-round match on Centre Court but was unable to beat Harmony Tan, losing the decisive third-set tiebreaker 10-7.
articles.content:
WIMBLEDON, England -- Serena Williams has lost her first singles match in nearly a year, getting beat by 115th-ranked Harmony Tan of France in a third-set tiebreaker at Wimbledon.

articles.title: Sources - Utah Jazz finalizing deal to make Boston Celtics assistant Will Hardy new head coach
articles.description: The Jazz are finalizing a deal with Celtics assistant Will Hardy to name him the franchise's new head coach, sources told ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski. Hardy, 34, will become the NBA's youngest active head coach.
